alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 12:41AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Bayfield, southeastern Washburn, southwestern Ashland and western Sawyer Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1241 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stone Lake, or 13 miles southwest of Chippewa Flowage West, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Couderay around 1245 AM CDT. Chief Lake on Chippewa Flowage, Little Round Lake and New Post around 1250 AM CDT. Chippewa Flowage West, Chippewa Flowage East and Round Lake around 1255 AM CDT. Clam Lake, Namekagon and Namekagon Lake around 110 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Reserve, Northwoods Beach, Chief Lake, Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation, Edgewater, Lost Land Lake, Little Sissabagama Lake, Grindstone Lake, Teal Lake and Sissabagama Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
